2007.text: Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
2007.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

2008.text: She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring.
2008.author: Zelda Fitzgerald

2009.text: A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance.
2009.author: Hunter S. Thompson

2010.text: I thought I'd lie on the floor and writhe in pain for a while," he grunted, "It relaxes me."
2010.author: Cassandra Clare

2011.text: By the pricking of my thumbs,
2011.author: William Shakespeare

2012.text: Even in the Future the Story Begins with Once Upon a Time.
2012.author: Marissa Meyer

2013.text: You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
2013.author: Chuck Palahniuk

2014.text: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee
2014.author: Robert Frost

2015.text: What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do.
2015.author: Alan Bennett

2016.text: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.
2016.author: Thomas Paine

2017.text: I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia.
2017.author: C.S. Lewis

2018.text: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.
2018.author: Anna Quindlen

2019.text: Time is the longest distance between two places.
2019.author: Tennessee Williams

2020.text: I may not have been sure about what really did interest me, but I was absolutely sure about what didn't.
2020.author: Albert Camus

2021.text: Did you ever think that in a past life Alec was an old woman with ninety cats who was always yelling at the neighborhood kids to get off her lawn? Because I do,
2021.author: Cassandra Clare

2022.text: Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been.
2022.author: Kurt Vonnegut

2023.text: No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.
2023.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

2024.text: the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
2024.author: Charles Bukowski

2025.text: No one has ever become poor by giving.
2025.author: Anne Frank

2026.text: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.
2026.author: Ernest Hemingway

2027.text: It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.
2027.author: J.K. Rowling

2028.text: Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.
2028.author: Rick Riordan

2029.text: We're staying together," he promised. "You're not getting away from me. Never again.
2029.author: Rick Riordan

2030.text: إن المرأة تحب رجلها ليس لأنه أقوى الرجال، و لا أوسمهم، و لا أغناهم، بل لأنه هو.. بضعفه و قوته.. و الحب ليس إستعراض قوة لكنه طاقة عطاء دافئة مستمرة
2030.author: أحمد خالد توفيق

2032.text: And I guess I realized at that moment that I really did love her. Because there was nothing to gain, and that didn't matter.
2032.author: Stephen Chbosky

2033.text: I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone.
2033.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

2034.text: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
2034.author: Abraham Lincoln

2035.text: The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.
2035.author: Carl Sagan

2036.text: You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.
2036.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

2037.text: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
2037.author: Kahlil Gibran

2038.text: Whenever you read a cancer booklet or website or whatever, they always list depression among the side effects of cancer. But, in fact, depression is not a side effect of cancer. Depression is a side effect of dying.
2038.author: John Green

2039.text: The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.
2039.author: Stephanie Perkins

2040.text: Ah, my daughter,ʺ he said. ʺEighteen, and already youʹve been accused of murder, aided felons, and acquired a death count higher than most guardians will ever see.ʺ He paused. ʺI couldnʹt be prouder.
2040.author: Richelle Mead

2041.text: Never make someone a priority when all you are to them is an option.
2041.author: Maya Angelou

2042.text: Courage is found in unlikely places.
2042.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

2043.text: There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.
2043.author: Beatrix Potter

2044.text: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
2044.author: Oscar Wilde

2045.text: Try a little harder to be a little better.
2045.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

2047.text: Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself.
2047.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

2048.text: The pleasure of remembering had been taken from me, because there was no longer anyone to remember with. It felt like losing your co-rememberer meant losing the memory itself, as if the things we'd done were less real and important than they had been hours before.
2048.author: John Green

2049.text: Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.
2049.author: Oscar Wilde

2050.text: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.
2050.author: Maya Angelou

2051.text: Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.
2051.author: Lemony Snicket

2052.text: Let me give you a piece of advice. The handsome young fellow who's trying to rescue you from a hideous fate is never wrong. Not even if he says the sky is purple and made of hedgehogs.
2052.author: Cassandra Clare

2053.text: That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.
2053.author: Arundhati Roy

2054.text: You could have fooled me. Everytime I called you, Luke said you were sick. I figured you were avoiding me. Again."
2054.author: Cassandra Clare

2055.text: It's not gray," Clary felt compelled to point out. "It's green."
2055.author: Cassandra Clare

2056.text: Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!
2056.author: Dr. Seuss

2057.text: There is only one page left to write on. I will fill it with words of only one syllable. I love. I have loved. I will love.
2057.author: Dodie Smith

2058.text: When we least expect it, life sets us a challenge to test our courage and willingness to change; at such a moment, there is no point in pretending that nothing has happened or in saying that we are not yet ready. The challenge will not wait. Life does not look back. A week is more than enough time for us to decide whether or not to accept our destiny.
2058.author: Paulo Coelho

2059.text: The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books.
2059.author: Katherine Mansfield

2060.text: When did we see each other face-to-face? Not until you saw into my cracks and I saw into yours. Before that, we were just looking at ideas of each other, like looking at your window shade but never seeing inside. But once the vessel cracks, the light can get in. The light can get out.
2060.author: John Green

2061.text: She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.
2061.author: Michael Ondaatje

2062.text: To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.
2062.author: Roy T. Bennett

2063.text: I don't want tea," said Clary, with muffled force. "I want to find my mother. And then I want to find out who took her in the first place, and I want to kill them."
2063.author: Cassandra Clare

2064.text: I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.
2064.author: Mae West

2065.text: Once upon a time, an angel and a devil fell in love.
2065.author: Laini Taylor

2067.text: May the odds be ever in your favor!
2067.author: Suzanne Collins

2068.text: Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.
2068.author: Lemony Snicket

2069.text: The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image.
2069.author: Thomas Merton

2070.text: You're just worried they'll hire a male instructor and he'll be hotter than you."
2070.author: Cassandra Clare

2071.text: Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.
2071.author: Cassandra Clare

2072.text: Did you know that 'I told you so' has a brother,Jacob?" she asked cutting me off. "His name is 'Shut the hell up'.
2072.author: Stephenie Meyer

2073.text: If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.
2073.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

2074.text: I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.
2074.author: Abraham Lincoln

2075.text: A childhood without books – that would be no childhood. That would be like being shut out from the enchanted place where you can go and find the rarest kind of joy.
2075.author: Astrid Lindgren

2076.text: I always channel my emotions into my work. That way, I don't hurt anyone but myself.
2076.author: Suzanne Collins

2077.text: We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.
2077.author: Santosh Kalwar

2079.text: Don't let the bastards grind you down.
2079.author: Margaret Atwood

2080.text: My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.
2080.author: Sarah J. Maas

2081.text: Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.
2081.author: Laini Taylor

2082.text: In time, the hurt began to fade and it was easier to just let it go. At least I thought it was. But in every boy I met in the next few years, I found myself looking for you, and when the feelings got too strong, I'd write you another letter. But I never sent them for fear of what I might find. By then, you'd gone on with your life and I didn't want to think about you loving someone else. I wanted to remember us like we were that summer. I didn't ever want to lose that.
2082.author: Nicholas Sparks

2084.text: If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more.
2084.author: Jane Austen

2085.text: Most of all, I hate you because I think of you. Often. It's disgusting, and I can't stop.
2085.author: Holly Black

2086.text: Peeta, how come I never know when you're having a nightmare? I say.
2086.author: Suzanne Collins

2087.text: Really, the combination of the scabs and the ointment looks hideous. I can't help enjoying his distress.
2087.author: Suzanne Collins

2088.text: Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.
2088.author: George Bernard Shaw

2089.text: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.
2089.author: Roy T. Bennett

2090.text: I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.
2090.author: Susan Sontag

2091.text: I want you always to remember me. Will you remember that I existed, and that I stood next to you here like this?
2091.author: Haruki Murakami

2092.text: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
2092.author: George Eliot

2093.text: Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.
2093.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

2095.text: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.
2095.author: Rumi

2096.text: When you play a game of thrones you win or you die.
2096.author: George R.R. Martin

2097.text: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.
2097.author: Blaise Pascal

2098.text: If you work really hard, and you're kind, amazing things will happen.
2098.author: Conan O'Brien

2099.text: Ah, music," he said, wiping his eyes. "A magic beyond all we do here!
2099.author: J.K. Rowling

2100.text: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
2100.author: Pablo Picasso

2101.text: Have you really read all those books in your room?
2101.author: John Green

2102.text: But in a solitary life, there are rare moments when another soul dips near yours, as stars once a year brush the earth. Such a constellation was he to me.
2102.author: Madeline Miller

2103.text: True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.
2103.author: Kiera Cass

2104.text: There is no place like home.
2104.author: L. Frank Baum

2105.text: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
2105.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2106.text: Give her hell from us, Peeves.
2106.author: J.K. Rowling

2107.text: The important thing to you is not how many years in your life, but how much life in your years!
2107.author: Edward J. Stieglitz

2108.text: Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.
2108.author: Markus Zusak

2109.text: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.
2109.author: Max Lucado

2110.text: What day is it? asked Pooh.
2110.author: A.A. Milne

2111.text: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.
2111.author: Deepak Chopra

2112.text: Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.
2112.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

2113.text: Remain true to yourself, child. If you know your own heart, you will always have one friend who does not lie.
2113.author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

2114.text: I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.
2114.author: Anne Frank

2115.text: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch.
2115.author: Orson Welles

2116.text: Tears are words that need to be written.
2116.author: Paulo Coelho

2117.text: A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.
2117.author: Charles Dickens

2118.text: Words were different when they lived inside of you.
2118.author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz

2119.text: Come sleep with me: We won't make Love, Love will make us.
2119.author: Julio Cortázar

2120.text: Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible.
2120.author: Doris Lessing

2121.text: Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters.
2121.author: Neil Gaiman

2122.text: If you love what you do and are willing to do what it takes, it's within your reach. And it'll be worth every minute you spend alone at night, thinking and thinking about what it is you want to design or build. It'll be worth it, I promise.
2122.author: Steve Wozniak

2123.text: و كن من أنتَ حيث تكون
2123.author: محمود درويش

2124.text: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
2124.author: Elie Wiesel

2125.text: I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!
2125.author: Dr. Seuss

2126.text: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.
2126.author: Lao Tzu

2127.text: I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like.
2127.author: Karen Marie Moning

2128.text: Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.
2128.author: Lauren Kate

2129.text: You'd think people had better things to gossip about," said Ginny as she sat on the common room floor, leaning against Harry’s legs and reading the Daily Prophet. "Three Dementor attacks in a week, and all Romilda Vane does is ask me if it’s true you’ve got a Hippogriff tattooed across your chest."
2129.author: J.K. Rowling

2131.text: I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.
2131.author: Rebecca West

2132.text: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it’s all an experience.
2132.author: Roy T. Bennett

2133.text: Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on.
2133.author: jonathan safran foer

2134.text: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected. Maybe they always have been and will be. Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other. And maybe each time, we've been forced apart for the same reasons. That means that this goodbye is both a goodbye for the past ten thousand years and a prelude to what will come.
2134.author: Nicholas Sparks

2135.text: It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.
2135.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

2136.text: Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.
2136.author: P.C. Cast

2137.text: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
2137.author: Socrates

2138.text: Maybe some people just aren't meant to be in our lives forever. Maybe some people are just passing through. It's like some people just come through our lives to bring us something: a gift, a blessing, a lesson we need to learn. And that's why they're here. You'll have that gift forever.
2138.author: Danielle Steel

2139.text: I'm going to wake Peeta," I say.
2139.author: Suzanne Collins

2140.text: The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.
2140.author: Nikolai V. Gogol

2141.text: The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.
2141.author: Charlotte Brontë

2142.text: Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you.
2142.author: Carl Sandburg

2143.text: A diary with no drawings of me in it? Where are the torrid fantasies? The romance covers?
2143.author: Cassandra Clare

2144.text: I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect.
2144.author: J.D. Salinger

2145.text: I'm a business man," he'd told her. "No more, no less."
2145.author: Leigh Bardugo

2146.text: so I wait for you like a lonely house
2146.author: Pablo Neruda

2147.text: There are so many ways to be brave in this world. Sometimes bravery involves laying down your life for something bigger than yourself, or for someone else. Sometimes it involves giving up everything you have ever known, or everyone you have ever loved, for the sake of something greater.
2147.author: Veronica Roth

2148.text: And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is.
2148.author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

2149.text: Fear is a phoenix. You can watch it burn a thousand times and still it will return.
2149.author: Leigh Bardugo

2150.text: I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.
2150.author: Virginia Woolf

2151.text: It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.
2151.author: Terry Pratchett

2152.text: Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I don’t go along with that. The memories I value most, I don’t ever see them fading.
2152.author: Kazuo Ishiguro

2153.text: He accused me of being Dumbledore's man through and through."
2153.author: J.K. Rowling

2154.text: We were like gods at the dawning of the world, & our joy was so bright we could see nothing else but the other.
2154.author: Madeline Miller

2155.text: You are all the colors in one, at full brightness.
2155.author: Jennifer Niven

2156.text: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
2156.author: Marcel Proust

2157.text: I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.
2157.author: J.D. Salinger

2158.text: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,
2158.author: Edgar Allan Poe

2159.text: From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.
2159.author: Edgar Allan Poe

2160.text: You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don’t make money your goal. Instead pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can’t take their eyes off of you.
2160.author: Maya Angelou

2161.text: He was gone, and I did not have time to tell him what I had just now realized: that I forgave him, and that she forgave us, and that we had to forgive to survive in the labyrinth. There were so many of us who would have to live with things done and things left undone that day. Things that did not go right, things that seemed okay at the time because we could not see the future. If only we could see the endless string of consequences that result from our smallest actions. But we can’t know better until knowing better is useless. And as I walked back to give Takumi’s note to the Colonel, I saw that I would never know. I would never know her well enough to know her thoughts in those last minutes, would never know if she left us on purpose. But the not-knowing would not keep me from caring, and I would always love Alaska Young, my crooked neighbor, with all my crooked heart.
2161.author: John Green

2162.text: There are two means of refuge from the misery of life — music and cats.
2162.author: Albert Schweitzer

2163.text: There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.
2163.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

2164.text: It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.
2164.author: John Updike

2165.text: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.
2165.author: Charles Lamb

2166.text: People come, people go – they’ll drift in and out of your life, almost like characters in a favorite book. When you finally close the cover, the characters have told their story and you start up again with another book, complete with new characters and adventures. Then you find yourself focusing on the new ones, not the ones from the past.
2166.author: Nicholas Sparks

2167.text: You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.
2167.author: Chuck Palahniuk

2168.text: He needed to tell her...what? That she was lovely and brave and better than anything he deserved. That he was twisted, crooked, wrong, but not so broken that he couldn't pull himself together into some semblance of a man for her. That without meaning to, he'd begun to lean on her, to look for her, to need her near. He needed to thank her for his new hat.
2168.author: Leigh Bardugo

2169.text: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
2169.author: Søren Kierkegaard

2170.text: Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.
2170.author: Dr. Seuss

2171.text: You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your
2171.author: Harlan Ellison

2172.text: Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more.
2172.author: Robert A. Heinlein

2173.text: When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.
2173.author: Margaret Walker

2174.text: It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party.
2174.author: Nick Hornby

2175.text: I read once that the ancient Egyptians had fifty words for sand & the Eskimos had a hundred words for snow. I wish I had a thousand words for love, but all that comes to mind is the way you move against me while you sleep & there are no words for that.
2175.author: Brian Andreas

2176.text: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.
2176.author: Yogi Berra

2177.text: Words, I think, are such unpredictable creatures.
2177.author: Tahereh Mafi

2178.text: Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.
2178.author: Harper Lee

2179.text: And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.
2179.author: Stephen Chbosky

2180.text: You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read...
2180.author: Keri Hulme

2181.text: If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.
2181.author: Robert Frost

2182.text: Lost love is still love. It takes a different form, that's all. You can't see their smile or bring them food or tousle their hair or move them around a dance floor. But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.
2182.author: Mitch Albom

2183.text: The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.
2183.author: J.K. Rowling

2184.text: I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.
2184.author: Jack Kerouac

2185.text: I cannot go to school today"
2185.author: Shel Silverstein

2186.text: I've got the guts to die. What I want to know is, have you got the guts to live?
2186.author: Tennessee Williams

2188.text: If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree.
2188.author: Michael Crichton

2189.text: It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.
2189.author: Rick Riordan

2190.text: It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.
2190.author: Emilie Autumn

2191.text: When I was your age, television was called books.
2191.author: William Goldman

2192.text: Boring damned people. All over the earth. Propagating more boring damned people. What a horror show. The earth swarmed with them.
2192.author: Charles Bukowski

2193.text: There's things that happen in a person's life that are so scorched in the memory and burned into the heart that there's no forgetting them.
2193.author: John Boyne

2194.text: The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones.
2194.author: Erin Morgenstern

2195.text: Pretty women wonder where my secret lies.
2195.author: Maya Angelou

2196.text: Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.
2196.author: Virginia Woolf

2197.text: You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.
2197.author: Roy T. Bennett

2198.text: The spell. Victor said you had to want me... to care about me... for it to work." When he didn't say anything, I tried to grip his shirt, but my fingers were too weak. "Did you? Did you want me?"
2198.author: Richelle Mead

2199.text: Somewhere over the rainbow, skies are blue, and the dreams that you dare to dream really do come true.
2199.author: E.Y. Harburg

2200.text: I used to dream about escaping my ordinary life, but my life was never ordinary. I had simply failed to notice how extraordinary it was.
2200.author: Ransom Riggs

2201.text: It's not always necessary to be strong, but to feel strong.
2201.author: Jon Krakauer

2202.text: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
2202.author: James Baldwin

2203.text: I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.
2203.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

2204.text: The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.
2204.author: Peter Shaffer

2206.text: I must have loved you a lot.
2206.author: Suzanne Collins

2207.text: Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities.
2207.author: Voltaire

2208.text: A word to the wise ain't necessary, it's the stupid ones who need advice.
2208.author: Bill Cosby

2209.text: Very few of us are what we seem.
2209.author: Agatha Christie

2210.text: You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.
2210.author: Ray Bradbury

2211.text: We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.
2211.author: Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy

2212.text: Sometimes, I feel the past and the future pressing so hard on either side that there's no room for the present at all.
2212.author: Evelyn Waugh

2213.text: Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?
2213.author: Stephanie Perkins

2214.text: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,
2214.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

2215.text: I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.
2215.author: Stephen King

2216.text: There is a crack in everything.
2216.author: Leonard Cohen

2217.text: You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.
2217.author: Suzanne Collins

2218.text: Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.
2218.author: E.E. Cummings

2219.text: Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.
2219.author: Stieg Larsson

2220.text: I like it when somebody gets excited about something. It's nice.
2220.author: J.D. Salinger

2221.text: As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world.
2221.author: Virginia Woolf

2222.text: I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.
2222.author: Mark Twain

2223.text: Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.
2223.author: Joyce Carol Oates

2224.text: [D]on't ever apologise to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for.
2224.author: Neil Gaiman

2226.text: Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.
2226.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

2227.text: The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people.
2227.author: Randy Pausch

2228.text: The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively.
2228.author: Bob Marley

2229.text: Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.
2229.author: Paulo Coelho

2230.text: Make your mistakes, take your chances, look silly, but keep on going. Don’t freeze up.
2230.author: Thomas Wolfe

2231.text: There must be those among whom we can sit down and weep and still be counted as warriors.
2231.author: Adrienne Rich

2232.text: A library is infinity under a roof.
2232.author: Gail Carson Levine

2233.text: You can make anything by writing.
2233.author: C.S. Lewis

2234.text: Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn.
2234.author: Sylvia Plath

2235.text: It is not the size of the dog in the fight that counts, but the fight in the dog that wins.
2235.author: Arthur G. Lewis

2236.text: Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside either. Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have. Like they did when they were your age. Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world.
2236.author: Neil Gaiman

2237.text: Even in half demon hunter clothes, Clary thought, he looked like the kind of boy who'd come over your house to pick you up for a date and be polite to your parents and nice to your pets.
2237.author: Cassandra Clare

2238.text: Black holes are where God divided by zero.
2238.author: Albert Einstein

2239.text: Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.
2239.author: Roy T. Bennett

2240.text: Truth only means something when it's hard to admit.
2240.author: Nicholas Sparks

2241.text: please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.
2241.author: Stephen Chbosky

2242.text: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.
2242.author: Oscar Wilde

2243.text: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.
2243.author: Michelle Hodkin

2244.text: This was another of our fears: that Life wouldn't turn out to be like Literature.
2244.author: Julian Barnes

2245.text: I like flaws. I think they make things interesting.
2245.author: Sarah Dessen

2246.text: The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history.
2246.author: George Orwell

2247.text: I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. I think you good, gifted, lovely: a fervent, a solemn passion is conceived in my heart; it leans to you, draws you to my centre and spring of life, wrap my existence about you–and, kindling in pure, powerful flame, fuses you and me in one.
2247.author: Charlotte Bronte

2248.text: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
2248.author: C.S. Lewis

2249.text: The world was collapsing, and the only thing that really mattered to me was that she was alive.
2249.author: Rick Riordan

2250.text: May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.
2250.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

2251.text: It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.
2251.author: Charles Dickens

2252.text: I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself
2252.author: Simone de Beauvoir

2253.text: I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes.
2253.author: Neil Gaiman

2254.text: I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.
2254.author: Anais Nin

2255.text: When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family.
2255.author: Jim Butcher

2256.text: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
2256.author: John Muir

2257.text: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?
2257.author: Jodi Picoult

2258.text: When you laugh, laugh like hell. And when you get angry, get good and angry. Try to be alive. You will be dead soon enough.
2258.author: William Saroyan

2259.text: A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.
2259.author: Maya Angelou

2260.text: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.
2260.author: Oscar Wilde

2261.text: Burdens are for shoulders strong enough to carry them.
2261.author: Margaret Mitchell

2262.text: I am free and that is why I am lost.
2262.author: Franz Kafka

2263.text: Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.
2263.author: Steve Martin

2264.text: Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.
2264.author: Roy T. Bennett

2265.text: Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.
2265.author: Toni Morrison

2266.text: We rip out so much of ourselves to be cured of things faster than we should that we go bankrupt by the age of thirty and have less to offer each time we start with someone new. But to feel nothing so as not to feel anything - what a waste!
2266.author: Andre Aciman

2267.text: No matter how careful you are, there's going to be the sense you missed something, the collapsed feeling under your skin that you didn't experience it all. There's that fallen heart feeling that you rushed right through the moments where you should've been paying attention.
2267.author: Chuck Palahniuk

2268.text: When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.
2268.author: George R.R. Martin

2269.text: Remember if people talk behind your back, it only means you are two steps ahead.
2269.author: Fannie Flagg

2270.text: الكراهية تكلف أكثر من الحب.. لأنها إحساس غير طبيعي.. إحساس عكسي مثل حركة الأجسام ضد جاذبية الأرض.. تحتاج إلى قوة إضافية وتستهلك وقوداً أكثر
2270.author: مصطفى محمود

2271.text: ...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?
2271.author: Vincent Willem van Gogh

2272.text: If I’m honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all.
2272.author: Audrey Hepburn

2273.text: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.
2273.author: Harvey Fierstein

2274.text: It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.
2274.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

2275.text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
2275.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2276.text: No book can be appreciated until it has been slept with and dreamed over.
2276.author: Eugene Field

2277.text: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.
2277.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

2278.text: You are not special. You're not a beautiful and unique snowflake. You're the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We're all part of the same compost heap. We're all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
2278.author: Chuck Palahniuk

2279.text: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.
2279.author: Bob Dylan

2280.text: My alone feels so good, I'll only have you if you're sweeter than my solitude.
2280.author: Warsan Shire

2281.text: You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help.
2281.author: Bill Watterson

2282.text: Ginny!" said Mr. Weasley, flabbergasted. "Haven't I taught you anything? What have I always told you? Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain?
2282.author: J.K. Rowling

2283.text: The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...
2283.author: Nicholas Sparks

2284.text: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.

2285.text: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.
2285.author: Alexandre Dumas

2286.text: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
2286.author: Sun Tzu

2287.text: Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins.

2288.text: Let the first act of every morning be to make the following resolve for the day:

2289.text: Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle.

2290.text: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
2290.author: Edmund Burke

2291.text: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.
2291.author: David Foster Wallace

2292.text: Forbidden to remember, terrified to forget; it was a hard line to walk.
2292.author: Stephenie Meyer

2293.text: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
2293.author: Andy Warhol

2294.text: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.
2294.author: Steve Jobs

2295.text: I will love you always. When this red hair is white, I will still love you. When the smooth softness of youth is replaced by the delicate softness of age, I will still want to touch your skin. When your face is full of the lines of every smile you have ever smiled, of every surprise I have seen flash through your eyes, when every tear you have ever cried has left its mark upon your face,I will treasure you all the more, because I was there to see it all. I will share your life with you, Meredith, and I will love you until the last breath leaves your body or mine.
2295.author: Laurell K. Hamilton

2296.text: If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you.
2296.author: Terry Pratchett

2297.text: Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them.
2297.author: Cornelia Funke

2298.text: Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.
2298.author: Roy T. Bennett

2299.text: Open your eyes and see what you can with them before they close forever.
2299.author: Anthony Doerr

2300.text: Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot.

2301.text: I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain.
2301.author: James Baldwin

2302.text: No sight so sad as that of a naughty child," he began, "especially a naughty little girl. Do you know where the wicked go after death?"
2302.author: Charlotte Brontë

2303.text: That's the thing about depression: A human being can survive almost anything, as long as she sees the end in sight. But depression is so insidious, and it compounds daily, that it's impossible to ever see the end.
2303.author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

2304.text: When I saw you I fell in love, and you smiled because you knew.
2304.author: Arrigo Boito

2305.text: I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.
2305.author: Ayn Rand

2306.text: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
