2880.text: Because,' she said, 'when you're scared but you still do it anyway,
2880.author: Neil Gaiman

2881.text: You're something between a dream and a miracle.
2881.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

2882.text: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
2882.author: Steve Maraboli

2883.text: Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass.
2883.author: Jonathan Kellerman

2884.text: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
2884.author: Zora Neale Hurston

2885.text: Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.
2885.author: e.e. cummings

2886.text: Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.
2886.author: Dean Koontz

2887.text: You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.
2887.author: Carlos Castaneda

2888.text: I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.
2888.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

2889.text: Ideally, what should be said to every child, repeatedly, throughout his or her school life is something like this: 'You are in the process of being indoctrinated. We have not yet evolved a system of education that is not a system of indoctrination. We are sorry, but it is the best we can do. What you are being taught here is an amalgam of current prejudice and the choices of this particular culture. The slightest look at history will show how impermanent these must be. You are being taught by people who have been able to accommodate themselves to a regime of thought laid down by their predecessors. It is a self-perpetuating system. Those of you who are more robust and individual than others will be encouraged to leave and find ways of educating yourself — educating your own judgements. Those that stay must remember, always, and all the time, that they are being moulded and patterned to fit into the narrow and particular needs of this particular society.
2889.author: Doris Lessing

2890.text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.

2891.text: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.

2892.text: The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.
2892.author: Napoleon Hill

2893.text: I'm going to keep going until I succeed — or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.
2893.author: J.K. Rowling

2894.text: The Darkling slumped back in his chair. Fine, he said with a weary shrug. Make me your villain.
2894.author: Leigh Bardugo

2895.text: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
2895.author: Rose Wilder Lane

2896.text: Don't let the muggles get you down.
2896.author: J.K. Rowling

2897.text: I am not an angel,' I asserted; 'and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate.
2897.author: Charlotte Brontë

2898.text: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
2898.author: Jennifer Niven

2899.text: As long as she thinks of a man, nobody objects to a woman thinking.
2899.author: Virginia Woolf

2900.text: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.
2900.author: Woody Allen

2901.text: Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.
2901.author: Roy T. Bennett

2902.text: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.
2902.author: H.L. Mencken

2903.text: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.
2903.author: Oscar Wilde

2904.text: When we are children we seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves us free to enjoy ourselves as few adults can. The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.
2904.author: Patrick Rothfuss

2905.text: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
2905.author: Charles Dickens

2906.text: We are always the same age inside.
2906.author: Gertrude Stein

2907.text: It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.
2907.author: John Green

2908.text: The sad truth is the truth is sad.
2908.author: Lemony Snicket

2910.text: That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.
2910.author: J.D. Salinger

2911.text: If you want to be happy, be.
2911.author: Tolstoy Leo

2912.text: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.
2912.author: Ken Kesey

2913.text: Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.
2913.author: Steve Jobs

2914.text: I restore myself when I'm alone.
2914.author: Marilyn Monroe

2915.text: Push yourself. Don't Settle. Just live well. Just LIVE.
2915.author: Jojo Moyes

2916.text: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
2916.author: Albert Einstein

2917.text: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand
2917.author: Hayley Williams

2918.text: You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift.
2918.author: Erin Morgenstern

2919.text: I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.
2919.author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

2920.text: Poetry is what happens when nothing else can.
2920.author: Charles Bukowski

2921.text: What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.
2921.author: George R.R. Martin

2922.text: I just want you to know that you’re very special… and the only reason I’m telling you is that I don’t know if anyone else ever has.
2922.author: Stephen Chbosky

2923.text: If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.
2923.author: Sherman Alexie

2924.text: If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.
2924.author: Ray Bradbury

2925.text: Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.
2925.author: Sarah Dessen

2926.text: Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.
2926.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

2927.text: Nothing on earth can make up for the loss of one who has loved you.
2927.author: Selma Lagerlöf

2928.text: I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with.
2928.author: Mary Ann Shaffer

2929.text: I didn’t go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don’t recommend Christianity.
2929.author: C. S. Lewis

2930.text: This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.
2930.author: Paulo Coelho

2931.text: Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.
2931.author: Jane Austen

2932.text: If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.
2932.author: Lewis Caroll

2933.text: If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?
2933.author: George Carlin

2934.text: Spring is the time of plans and projects.
2934.author: Leo Tolstoy

2935.text: Question everything. Your love, your religion, your passion. If you don't have questions, you'll never find answers.
2935.author: Colleen Hoover

2936.text: There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, 'There now, hang on, you'll get over it.' Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.
2936.author: Barbara Kingsolver

2937.text: True friends are always together in spirit.
2937.author: L.M. Montgomery

2938.text: If I should have a daughter…Instead of Mom, she’s gonna call me Point B. Because that way, she knows that no matter what happens, at least she can always find her way to me. And I’m going to paint the solar system on the back of her hands so that she has to learn the entire universe before she can say Oh, I know that like the back of my hand.
2938.author: Sarah Kay

2939.text: The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.
2939.author: C. JoyBell C.

2940.text: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane
2940.author: Rachel Caine

2941.text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity
2941.author: Albert Einstein

2942.text: I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me."
2942.author: Suzanne Collins

2943.text: People speak sometimes about the "bestial" cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts, no animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel.
2943.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

2944.text: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation. From the desperate city you go into the desperate country, and have to console yourself with the bravery of minks and muskrats. A stereotyped but unconscious despair is concealed even under what are called the games and amusements of mankind. There is no play in them, for this comes after work. But it is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things..
2944.author: Henry David Thoreau

2945.text: I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.
2945.author: Brian Selznick

2946.text: Can you be a girl for a few seconds?"
2946.author: Veronica Roth

2947.text: People are capable, at any time in their lives, of doing what they dream of.
2947.author: Paulo Coelho

2948.text: And so I try to be kind to everything I see, and in everything I see, I see him.
2948.author: Hanya Yanagihara

2949.text: My only love sprung from my only hate!
2949.author: William Shakespeare

2950.text: You - you alone will have the stars as no one else has them...In one of the stars I shall be living. In one of them I shall be laughing. And so it will be as if all the stars were laughing, when you look at the sky at night...You - only you - will have stars that can laugh.
2950.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

2951.text: Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary.
2951.author: Tamora Pierce

2952.text: Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig.
2952.author: Robert Heinlein

2953.text: Don't waste your love on somebody, who doesn't value it.
2953.author: William Shakespeare

2954.text: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
2954.author: Ben Okri

2955.text: sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love
2955.author: Gabriel García Márquez

2956.text: I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.
2956.author: Walter Tevis

2957.text: You think the dead we loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?
2957.author: J.K. Rowling

2958.text: A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?
2958.author: Albert Einstein

2959.text: The mystery of human existence lies not in just staying alive, but in finding something to live for.
2959.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

2960.text: One must dare to be happy.
2960.author: Gertrude Stein

2961.text: When they asked me what I wanted to be I said I didn’t know.
2961.author: Sylvia Plath

2962.text: Sleep, those little slices of death — how I loathe them.
2962.author: Edgar Allan Poe

2963.text: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.
2963.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

2964.text: Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars.
2964.author: Haruki Murakami

2965.text: One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.
2965.author: Lewis Carroll

2966.text: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
2966.author: Albert Einstein

2967.text: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.
2967.author: Tim O'Brien

2969.text: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.
2969.author: Suzanne Collins

2970.text: I like it when a flower or a little tuft of grass grows through a crack in the concrete. It's so fuckin' heroic.
2970.author: George Carlin

2971.text: I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I’m too tired to be me.
2971.author: Jarod Kintz

2972.text: Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent. To sit with a dog on a hillside on a glorious afternoon is to be back in Eden, where doing nothing was not boring--it was peace.
2972.author: Milan Kundera

2973.text: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
2973.author: Robert Frost

2974.text: I just want to be wonderful.
2974.author: Marilyn Monroe

2975.text: Demons run when a good man goes to war
2975.author: Steven Moffat

2976.text: If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. "No, I won't let you." "Trust me," I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. "On the count of three?" Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. "The count of three," he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. "Hold them out. I want everyone to see," he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. "One." Maybe I'm wrong. "Two." Maybe they don't care if we both die. "Three!" It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. "Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!
2976.author: Suzanne Collins

2977.text: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.
2977.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2978.text: None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have faith.
2978.author: Paulo Coelho

2979.text: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.
2979.author: Nora Roberts

2980.text: I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....
2980.author: Erica Jong

2981.text: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
2981.author: Samuel Beckett

2982.text: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
2982.author: Mother Teresa

2983.text: Crows remember human faces. They remember the people who feed them, who are kind to them. And the people who wrong them too. They don’t forget. They tell each other who to look after and who to watch out for.
2983.author: Leigh Bardugo

2984.text: الحداد ليس في ما نرتديه بل في ما نراه . إنّه يكمن في نظرتنا
2984.author: أحلام مستغانمي

2985.text: I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.
2985.author: Chaim Potok

2986.text: Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!
2986.author: C. J. Cherryh

2987.text: This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.
2987.author: James Lecesne

2988.text: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
2988.author: Marcus Aurelius

2989.text: But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not.
2989.author: John Steinbeck

2990.text: A single person is missing for you, and the whole world is empty.
2990.author: Philippe Ariès

2991.text: I will take the sun in my mouth
2991.author: E.E. Cummings

2992.text: Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.
2992.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

2993.text: If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear.
2993.author: A.A. Milne

2994.text: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
2994.author: James Baldwin

2995.text: A man should hear a little music, read a little poetry, and see a fine picture every day of his life, in order that worldly cares may not obliterate the sense of the beautiful which God has implanted in the human soul.
2995.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

2996.text: The past beats inside me like a second heart.
2996.author: John Banville

2997.text: I don't care," Clary said. "He'd do it for me. Tell me he wouldn't. If I were missing-"
2997.author: Cassandra Clare

2998.text: It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.
2998.author: Lois Lowry

2999.text: I'm not lost for I know where I am. But however, where I am may be lost.
2999.author: A.A. Milne
